      static java.text.SimpleDateFormat createSimpleDateFormatTreatment() 
      void deleteEntry(VaultEntry entry)
      Deprecated. 
      This method is currently broken: Nightscout seems to not actually delete any entries even if a valid ID is provided. Thus this method will always throw an exception.
      void deleteTreatment(VaultEntry treatment)
      Deprecated. 
      This method is currently broken: Nightscout seems to return inconsistent responses even if it successfully deletes the treatment. Thus this method may throw unexpected exceptions.

        Constructs a new NighScout API instance. Connects to the specified host and port, using the given token for all queries
        Parameters:
        host - Host to connect to
        secret - Your API-Secret

                 throws NightscoutIOException,
                        NightscoutServerException
        Sends a GET request for the status
        Returns:
        the status as a JSON formatted String
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status

      • getEntries

        public GetBuilder getEntries()
        Creates a GetBuilder for entries
        Returns:
        a GetBuilder with "entries" as its path

      • getEntries

        public java.util.List<VaultEntry> getEntries(java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor latest,
                                             java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor oldest,
                                             int batchSize)
                                      throws NightscoutIOException,
                                             NightscoutServerException
        Fetches all entries from Nightscout that are in between the given latest and oldest time (inclusive). Entries are fetched in batches with the given batch size until Nightscout returns no more results.
        Parameters:
        latest - latest point in time, has to be formatable with DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME
        oldest - oldest point in time, has to be formatable with DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME
        batchSize - amount of entries fetched at once
        Returns:
        list of fetched entries
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status
        java.time.DateTimeException - if an error occurs while formatting latest or oldest

      • getSlice

        public GetBuilder getSlice(java.lang.String storage,
                           java.lang.String field,
                           java.lang.String type,
                           java.lang.String prefix,
                           java.lang.String regex)
        Creates a GetBuilder for slices
        Parameters:
        storage - Prefix to use in constructing a prefix-based regex, e.g. entries.
        field - Name of the field to use Regex against in query object, e.g. dateString.
        type - The type field to search against, e.g. sgv.
        prefix - Prefix to use in constructing a prefix-based regex.
        regex - Tail part of regexp to use in expanding/construccting a query object. Regexp also has bash-style brace and glob expansion applied to it, creating ways to search for modal times of day, perhaps using something like this syntax: T{15..17}:.*, this would search for all records from 3pm to 5pm.
        Returns:
        a GetBuilder with the given parameters as its path

      • getEcho

        public GetBuilder getEcho(java.lang.String storage,
                          java.lang.String spec)
        Information about the mongo query object created by the query.
        Parameters:
        storage - entries, or treatments to select the storage layer.
        spec - entry id, such as 55cf81bc436037528ec75fa5 or a type filter such as sgv, mbg, etc. This parameter is optional.
        Returns:
        a GetBuilder with the given parameters as its path

      • getTimesEcho

        public GetBuilder getTimesEcho(java.lang.String prefix,
                               java.lang.String regex)
        Echo debug information about the query object constructed.
        Parameters:
        prefix - Prefix to use in constructing a prefix-based regex.
        regex - Tail part of regexp to use in expanding/construccting a query object. Regexp also has bash-style brace and glob expansion applied to it, creating ways to search for modal times of day, perhaps using something like this syntax: T{15..17}:.*, this would search for all records from 3pm to 5pm.
        Returns:
        a GetBuilder with the given parameters as its path

      • getTimes

        public GetBuilder getTimes(java.lang.String prefix,
                           java.lang.String regex)
        The Entries endpoint returns information about the Nightscout entries.
        Parameters:
        prefix - Prefix to use in constructing a prefix-based regex.
        regex - Tail part of regexp to use in expanding/construccting a query object. Regexp also has bash-style brace and glob expansion applied to it, creating ways to search for modal times of day, perhaps using something like this syntax: T{15..17}:.*, this would search for all records from 3pm to 5pm.
        Returns:
        a GetBuilder with the given parameters as its path

      • getTreatments

        public GetBuilder getTreatments()
        The Treatments endpoint returns information about the Nightscout treatments.
        Returns:
        a GetBuilder with treatments as its path

      • getTreatments

        public java.util.List<VaultEntry> getTreatments(java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor latest,
                                                java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor oldest,
                                                int batchSize)
                                         throws NightscoutIOException,
                                                NightscoutServerException
        Fetches all treatments from Nightscout that are in between the given latest and oldest time (inclusive). Treatments are fetched in batches with the given batch size until Nightscout returns no more results.
        Parameters:
        latest - latest point in time, has to be formatable with DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME
        oldest - oldest point in time, has to be formatable with DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME
        batchSize - amount of entries fetched at once
        Returns:
        list of fetched entries
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status
        java.time.DateTimeException - if an error occurs while formatting latest or oldest

      • createPost

        public PostBuilder createPost(java.lang.String path)

      • postEntries

        public void postEntries(java.util.List<VaultEntry> entries,
                        int batchSize)
                 throws NightscoutIOException,
                        NightscoutServerException,
                        NightscoutDataException
        Sends one or more POST requests with the given entries as their payloads. Splits the list into smaller batches to upload individually. Uses NightscoutExporter to export the data.
        Parameters:
        entries - data
        batchSize - maximum amount of entries to send in one POST request
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status
        NightscoutDataException - if an exception occurs while exporting the data

      • postEntries

        public void postEntries(java.util.List<VaultEntry> entries)
                 throws NightscoutIOException,
                        NightscoutServerException,
                        NightscoutDataException
        Sends a POST request with the given entries as its payload. Uses NightscoutExporter to export the data.
        Parameters:
        entries - data
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status
        NightscoutDataException - if an exception occurs while exporting the data

      • postTreatments

        public void postTreatments(java.util.List<VaultEntry> treatments,
                           int batchSize)
                    throws NightscoutIOException,
                           NightscoutServerException,
                           NightscoutDataException
        Sends one or more POST requests with the given treatments as their payloads. Splits the list into smaller batches to upload individually. Uses NightscoutExporter to export the data.
        Parameters:
        treatments - data
        batchSize - maximum amount of treatments to send in one POST request
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status
        NightscoutDataException - if an exception occurs while exporting the data

      • postTreatments

        public void postTreatments(java.util.List<VaultEntry> treatments)
                    throws NightscoutIOException,
                           NightscoutServerException,
                           NightscoutDataException
        Sends a POST request with the given treatments as its payload. Uses NightscoutExporter to export the data.
        Parameters:
        treatments - data
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status
        NightscoutDataException - if an exception occurs while exporting the data

      • deleteEntry

        @Deprecated
public void deleteEntry(VaultEntry entry)
                             throws NightscoutIOException,
                                    NightscoutServerException
        Deprecated. This method is currently broken: Nightscout seems to not actually delete any entries even if a valid ID is provided. Thus this method will always throw an exception.
        Deletes the given VaultEntry by first sending a GET request to the Nightscout server to find the id of the entry. Then sends a DELETE request with the id of the entry.
        Parameters:
        entry - entry to delete
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status

      • deleteTreatment

        @Deprecated
public void deleteTreatment(VaultEntry treatment)
                                 throws NightscoutIOException,
                                        NightscoutServerException
        Deprecated. This method is currently broken: Nightscout seems to return inconsistent responses even if it successfully deletes the treatment. Thus this method may throw unexpected exceptions.
        Deletes the given VaultEntry by first sending a GET request to the Nightscout server to find the id of the treatment. Then sends a DELETE request with the id of the treatment.
        Parameters:
        treatment - treatment to delete
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
        NightscoutServerException - if the Nightscout server returns a bad response status

      • checkStatusOk

        public boolean checkStatusOk()
        Checks that the Nightscout server is reachable and that the status is ok and the api is enabled. Logs exceptions and problems with LOGGER.
        Returns:
        true if everything is ok, false otherwise

      • printStatus

        public java.lang.String printStatus()
        Fetches the status and formats it for logging.
        Returns:
        formatted String containing status information

      • printStatus

        public java.lang.String printStatus(Status status)
        Formats the status for logging.
        Parameters:
        status - Status of the Nightscout server
        Returns:
        formatted String containing status information
